text: Bottle - sublime - milk choc roast malt hint of smoke all seamlessly integrated - I could drink another straight away.

Bottle 330ml. @ home. [ As BrewDog / Victory Brewing U-Boat ].Clear dark black brown colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, dark malt, roasted, wood, smoke, alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, dark malt, molasses, roasted, wood, smoked. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20170413]
 8-4-8-4-16
I always struggle with the smoked ales, I found the U-Boat to be very pleasurable, with an earthy peat aroma, and lingering bitterness pepper spice bite, along with heavy rich malt flavours, warming.

Chocolate malt spice herbal aroma. Dark brown colour poor head and lacing. Malt caramel chocolate flavour. Smooth palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle(22-Mar-17)Sweet choc roast aroma. Black,poor head and suds lacing. Sweet roast choc malt flavour. Bitter roast choc finish and toffee vanilla herbal aftertaste.
27-01-17 // bottle shared at home. Pours a deep black beer with a solid beige head. Medium skomey nose. Taste is sweet smokey malty with chocolate cocoa coffee, toasted bread, caramel.
Bottle. Pours black with a finger of beige head. Hints of smoke and malt. Lightbodied, bitter sweet in taste with hints of smoke and some roast in the aftertaste..
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Casi negra, fina espuma beige, que no dura nada. Potente aroma licórico, ahumado, notas de chocolate. Oleosa, densa, petróleo. Tremendo cuerpo. Intenso sabor. Rica malta tostada, chocolate y coco. Licor. Apenas gas. Postgusto excelente, chocolate de nuevo, café, y calor alcohólico. Los labios quedan pastosos, esperando el siguiente trago. Bestial.
Opaque black, beige head, yeasty aroma, coffee, caramel, honey, sweet, yeasty flavor, coffee, roasted, nice, sweet, a bit of smoke, medium bodied.

Wow.

33 cl bottle at Gourmet Callao, Madrid, 9th floor, view all over Spains capital city center at dusk, pairing it with Gillardeau oysters -perfect moment!

Pours pitch bright black, ephemerous tan head. Intense aroma is quite peculiar: soy sauce, squid ink, leather, chocolate, tomato jam and vanilla pods. Mouthfeel is dense, sweetish and powerful. Low carb. Taste is umami and metallic. Slow-going. Very long finish with huge notes of dark coffee and restrained bitterness. Great.

Have one whenever you can, trust me.

33cl bottle courtesy of Jmgreenuk. 
Medium tan head. Clear black pour. Nice smokey aftertaste

Bottle shared thanks to Deanso. Road soda as his #9000 tick! Black with a tan head. Aroma of roast, dark chocolate, caramel, toffee, licorice and malt. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Pours pretty much black with a beige head. Aroma of chocolate with a little smoke. More of both in the taste with some dark fruits and cocoa powder. Some burnt molasses. Fairly full bodied with a little bit of hop kick right at the very end.

Bottle from systembolaget Sweden. Short light brown head. Big chocolate aroma with a touch of smoke 
Sweet chocolate taste with a medium body and salty tuch. A bit to one dimensional.

Bardzo wyraźny susz owocowy w aromacie z dużą ilością śliwek.
Aromat wędzony delikatnie z ledwo wyłapaną szynką.
Wygląd ładny z obfitą beżową pianą.
W smaku mocno wysycone, śliwkowe i słodkie.
Fajny portrer chyba trochę imo mało wędzony.
Black with beige head. Roasted smell, with some smoke hints as well. Chocolate, coffee and some more smoke in the taste. Finish falls a bit short. An ok Smoked.

Sokáig tartó közepes, szép kávé színű hab. Színe koromfekete. Pörkölt, füstös, kissé édeskés illat. Íze kiegyensúlyozott, pörkölt, feketekávés fő vonásokkal, füstös mellékízzel. Finom telt íz. Utóízét pörkölt keserűsség jellemzi, ami sokáig kitart.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours pitch black with a small tan head and an aroma of smoked eel, roasted malts, dark chocolate, espresso, ripe cherries and toasted bread. The taste is light to medium sweet with lots of smoked flavour. Really nice beer!

A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, coffee, and chocolate, leading to a dry roasted finish.

from Amstein - black beer with a dark beige foam; gently smoky aroma, very chocolaty with notes of nuts and vanilla; full-bodied, fairly sweet, moderate carbonation; lot of chocolate and vanilla in the finish where the smokiness stays behind

Medium-smoked aroma with some roasty, nuts and huge caramel punch. Minimal brown head, beer is nearly black, medium-sparkling. Its real good baltic porter, but in my opinion, could have more smoked aroma and taste.

BBE 22-07-17. Mustanpunainen, olematon vaahto. Suutuntuma hapokas, mausteinen, alkoholi tulee lievästi esiin, lievän vetinen body, helpohko kuitenkin juoda. Tahmea ja mukavan lämmittävä jälkifiilis vaikkei hirveän makealta tunnukaan. Smokediksi superhyvä, yleistasolla vain hyvä.

33cl bottle. Opaque dark brown/black colour with a thin tan head. Chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, nuts, smoked and toffee in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is a complex mixture of sweet chocolate, roasted coffee, bitter and smoked notes all well balanced. Overall, a very good beer.

Flasch: Black coloured, small n stable tanned head; solid sweet nose of dried fruits and caramel, faint traces of smoked malt and hops; moderate to solid sweet-bitter flavour, full bodied, really soft; lingering sweet-bitter finish presenting toasted malt and traces of chocolate. Despite its strength, very moreish

Kolor : Czarny. Lekkie rubinowe refleksy. 
Piana: Beżowa. Średniotrwała. 
Brudzi szkło w umiarkowanym stopniu.
Pozostawia pojedyńcze plamki na szkle. 
Zapach: Poezja! To się nazywa PRAWDZIWA wędzonka! Nie jakieś tam Dupy Smalone czy inne Mehehehe..;)
Zapach intensywny. Dym torfowy. Wędzony boczek. Na drugim planie czekolada gorzka i kawa. 
Smak: W smaku ntensywne nuty kawowo-czekoladowe. Wędzonka mocna , aromatyczna, pachnąca i bardzo smaczna. 
Nawet teraz mi ślinka cieknie na samą myśl jak to piszę, a butelka już dawno pusta. 
Porter stosunkowo słodki w smaku - z akcentami wanilii i karmelu. Nie jest to jednak muląca słodycz.
Goryczka średnio intensywna. Alkohol idealnie ukryty. 
Wysycenie : Średnie. 
Podsumowanie:  
Kolejne piwo z BrewDoga i kolejny strzał w dziesiątkę. Piwo jest świetne. Aromaty czekoladowo-kawowe bardzo trwałe i intensywne.
Smak i zapach wędzonki mocno wyczuwalny. 
Piwo gęste i treściwe. 
Na pewno jeszcze do niego wrócę.

Look: dark, opaque, clear, dark head with average retention.

Aroma: sweet milk chocolate, withl light smoked notes.
Taste: light to moderate sweetness with prominent bitterness.
Flavour: milk chocolate, crème brûlée, sweet strong coffee, dried black olives.
Finish is burned with grassy hops and oily dried olives.

Good but not too smoked.
Nera e oleosa. Malto tostato, nocciole, fumo, caramello, corpo relativamente lieve, struttura "scivolosa", poco carbonara. Discreta.

Appearance: Batch 251. Very dark brown, near black. Huge amount of lasting, dark tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, bacon, smoke.
Taste: Dark fruit, dark malt, smoke, coffee, very roasted. Still pretty smooth, though.
Bought: Drinks of the World (Bern), 330 ml, CHF 5.80
Info: 27/12-2015, BB: 22/7-2017

December 25, 2015. Bottle, best before july 22, 2017.

Clear almost black with a small tan head. Aroma is light soft smoked, hints of dark berries, toffee, ash and dark bread. Taste is medium sweet, soft bitter and light smokey. Finish is sweet bready, berries, soft bitter roasted and smoked notes. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Good porter, not a lot of smokiness going on but good for a porter.

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 22/07/17 Pours hazy dark brown to black liquid, small frothy brown head, Aroma: dark chocolate, espresso, warming alcohol, milk, coconut, red fruits, cherries, Taste: medium to heavy sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light to medium sour, dark chocolate, red fruits, citrus, lemon peel, sour notes, cherries, raisins, espresso, mineral, Palate: medium body soft to average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long bitter citrus aftertaste, Overall: fine, enjoyed.
Nice and easy smokey porter. Moderate smokiness on a relatively large body and apparent sweetness. Well balanced to the beautiful bitterness.
Lekker makkelijk bruin rakkertje met chocolade tonen in de barley smaak. Blijft redelijk fris en opgewekt ten opzichte van zn kleur. Backlog from 2014/11/09.

Bottled - Dark brown/black colour, medium sized, thick tan head, good retention and lacing. Burnt and slight ashy aromas, roasted nuts, coffee, chocolate and just a touch of smoke. Taste of chocolate, burnt breadcrust, dried red fruits, caramel and some wood with earthy tones. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture, roasty and a bit astringent finish with a slight smokiness in the end. I like that the smoke doesnt take over, its just completes the beer. Very delicious.

Black in colour with a creamy head. Aroma of some smoked malt and some chocolate together with some burnt sugar and dark dried fruits. Some vanilla and alcohol. Taste of some roasted malt with dark chocolate, some vanilla and sine dried fruits. Relatively light in taste.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

330ml bottle from Brewdog.com (£4.00):
This one was a really nice smoked porter, possibly the first of this type of beer that Ive tried in a while. Definitely one that I enjoyed with the strong smoky flavours (naturally) & some good roasted malts but the beer still held a nice balance & went down more easily than expected; a great beer & one well worth trying if you can get a hold of one now.

Bottle shared at a tasting (Thanks Viktor!). Pours a deep black with ruby highlights. Roasted malt, cacao, brown sugar and burned molasses on the nose. Some sourness that comes out on the palate with lots of bitter, dry and roasted character. Like charred coffee almost. The smoke is very mild, almost non-existent to be exact, but it is there in the corner, hiding. Dry finish. Overrated I feel.
Nice, sweet and smoky baltic porter with nice and firm notes of chocolate, coffee and some oakish smoke.

Warning: This review is written considering price in Poland (18 polish zl for 33cl, comparing to leading baltic porters at 6 polish zl for 50cl)
I would not recomend this beer for Polish residents. It is very simmilar to Baltic Porter but not as rich. and smooth like for example Porter from Ciechan or Grand from Amber.
Overaly very good beer, but facing strong competition localy.

Dark black, consistence of motor oil - thick and siropy. Beige thick head with lacing. Nice, low carb palate. Aroma molasses, raisins, tobacco and smoke. Taste complex with molasses, caramel, milk chocolate raisins and salty-like smoke finish. Alcohol well hidden. Good one.

Bottle @ home. Black colour, small light brown head. Smells vanilla, sweet, chocolate, roasty. Tastes chocolate, vanilla, roasty with a smokey aftertaste. Very nice. Medium to full body, silky feel, soft carbo.
330ml bottle from Good Spirits Co. Almost black, reasonable tan head. Treacle chocolate alcohol aroma. Sweet smoked peaty barley flavour. Peaty alcohol aftertaste. Sorry I dont like this.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2015 Bottle 330ml (22.07.2017). Beer is almost black like deep of the ocean, totally unclear with brown head, which disappeared very fast, unfortunately. Aroma is a bit smoked directly from the bottle. There are notes of chocolate, alcohol like liqueur, cherries in chocolate from the glass. Chocolate, medium to full body, a bit sweet in taste with small sour note at the finish. Alcohol well hidden, medium sweet, a bit oily in texture with long sweet finish, very pleasant. Good drinkable and quite light if we look at the power of this beer. Very good beer, deep, chocolate as the depth at which descended U-Boats. But, smoked note should be a bit more.

Nice nearly black color. Very small and quick disappearing head. Aroma: citrus and smoku aromas with roasty tones, a bit of caramel. Taste: full od smoked Grass with roasty caramel. Bitterness is not strong nearly unnoticable. Alcohol notes are present but then are not unpleasant. Oily and full body, soft carbonated and Suprisingly mentor aftertaste. Nice one!

Bottle. Dark colour, beige head. Complex aroma - roasted, caramel, nuts, mollasses. Taste also very complex and massive. Sweet begining, caramel, changes into very pleasant roastiness. Full body. This beer is very complex and very good.
Bottle. Pours deep brown with small white head. Aroma of malt, fruits, beachwood smoke. In taste roasty, smoky with caramel and burned sugar notes. Medium body, decent herbal bitterness. Nice beer.

.4%. It poured jet-black with good carbonation and a one-finger tan head. The aroma was powerful: medium smokiness with caramel, cocoa, dark berries and just a hint, if Im not imagining it, of lager. Taste wise, this was a rich beer. Viscous and creamy with a chewy edge that reminds you of its strength but in a good way. There is a peat smokiness but also caramel, coffee, raisins and some dark fruit: maybe plums? Certainly a well concocted beer that retains its complex balancing act through to the bitter-sweet red fruit and currant finish.

A bastard son of a Milk Chocolate Stout and a lager; despite my initial scepticism, it works really well.

(bottle, 33cl) Almost black colour with a brown and firm mid-sized foamy head. Roasty and earthy malty aroma with notes of burnt sugar, chocolate, vanilla, ashes and beechwood smoke. Moderately sweet and delicately bitter flavour, medium bodied with a smooth carbonation. Slightly molassy and roasted malty taste with notes of chocolate, caramel, marzipan and shades of smoke; moderately sweet and surprisingly delicately roasty bitter finish with notes of chocolate and mocha, lingering into the aftertaste. 23.III.15

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small to medium tan head. Aroma of dark fruit, smoke, raisins, chocolate, caramel, light ash and toast. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes smoke, chocolate, licorice, light ash and dried fruit. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Nice. Smokey and complex.
Bottle. Nice mouthfeel, with a nice bitter-sweet balance. Smoke is not too strong, just enough to be noticeable.

Bottle 33cl, a Summer Santa gift, many thanks ! A dark beer with low brown head. Nose is intense on dark chocolate, prune and light smoked touch. Aroma is on dark malt, dark chocolate, biscuit and caramel, peppery, sweet, little spicy, medium creamy, smoked notes are subtle. As the beer temperature grows the body becomes more vinous with a kind of barrel aged profile, berries, still black pepper notes with round dark chocolate dominant. Finish has a touch of toffee, toasted caramel and smoked touch.
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of chocolate, smoked, cocoa, dark fruits. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, roasted, chocolate, cocoa, plums, coffee.
KØLF 090115. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, grain. Flavour is roasted malt, coffee, hop, cocoa, pine, grain, chocolate. Full body. Very nice beer.
Bottle. Black color with thin beige head. Aroma is complex: chocolate, cocoa, berries, dry fruits. Taste is rich and complex: medium sweet, smoked. Thick texture. Finish is long, tobacco. Nice beer!

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This is an inky black beer that pours with quickly disappearing tan head. It has a very rich dark chocolate, vanilla, oak and milk chocolate flavour, spicy, sweet, fruity and lightly smoked beechwood notes followed by a creamy, tart red fruit and currant finish. Superb!

6/V/15 - 33cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: n/a (2015-598)  
Clear dark brown to black beer, big aery beige head, continuously fed by small streams of tiny bubbles in the glass, pretty stable, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet, lots of dried fruits, prunes, mocha, overripe banana, fudge, caramel. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, bit sourish, lots of caramel, mocha, very roasted. Aftertaste: bitter, coffee, smoky touch, dried fruits, cocoa powder, dark chocolate, bitter touch, caramel.

Bottle @ home. Pours with a pitch black colour, small fast diminshing tan head. Aroma is quite smoky (not overwhelmingly) and roasty; quite hoppy too. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, slightly sour. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation.

So etwas gefällt auch mir. Schön im Kaffee mit einem Schuss Milch, dabei dennoch nicht überladen oder zu süß. Gar ein bisschen Hopfen im Hintergrund, eine feine Perlung und etwas Schoko. Absolut in Ordnung für ein dunkles Piwo.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a deep black colour with a steady head and smooth body. Aroma of chocolate and woods. Taste of intense malt, intense chocolate, coffee beans, woods and light cake. Hints of leather. Chocolate finish. Wonderful quaffable and smooth to drink with no real smokey hints to notice.
Dark brown with brown head (1 finger). Woody roasty hint of smoke aroma. Coffee, roast with caramel, hint of smoky but not predominant character. Enjoyable beer from two of my favorite breweries.

Bottle from McHughs. Pours black with reddish hue with wispy tan head. Slight smoke, lactose, light coffee, milk chocolate nose. Burnt Toast, smoky, lactose flavour. Flavour is too sweet for my taste with a lot of milk. Needs a bit more balance with smoky flavour. Not bad

Decent beer with lots of compomises. Not a bad thing. A bit too sweet for me. The smoky aroma and flavor are moderate. Flavor is chocolate, cheese, ham and little bit charcoal. Oily texture. Overall OK but nothing more fancy then that. I mean I enjoy it and this beer is solid but I was expecting some more bite into smokiness and all I got is a sweet ham and a dizzle of charcoal.

Bottle. A strong smell of chocolate, some smoked bacon. The head is small, beige and fizzy with a short duration. The body is black. A strong taste of malt and chocolate but no roasted malt. The body is strong, very creamy and quite oily with a soft carbonation. A nice beer but not a lot of smoke.

Interesting restyled porter produced with lager yeast. The traditional porter aroma and flavor are not satisfy but the smoked and dark malt aroma are smart and well balanced. The foam is dark and color and not so persistent. No yeast on bottom and perfect. black in color

Draught at Triangle, Paris, 4/25/15Soft milk chocolate brown colored body is topped by a frail beige head that recedes to cover. Clarity seems to be high, though I didnt really test it.Light tobacco and leather in the nose gives way to dark chocolate and plentiful, sweet caramel notes. Vanilla is soft and there does seem to be a hint of citrusy hop aroma which is at odds with the chocolate and caramel. Very muted and understated overall. Couldnt discern the smoked portion from the nose. No alcohol noted.Sweet, not cloyingly so, though with a blend of vanilla notes, milk chocolate and dry graham cracker-like grains that attempt to balance. On the far end, the smoke is noted; light tobacco and leather with no bacon or any heavy smokiness. Texture is malty and comforting, with a moderately sweet finish, growing sweeter as it warms. The citrus from the hops comes off lightly oily and with the acids not complementing the milk chocolate and caramel flavors. Its fine that this isnt a smoke bomb, as its good to make a balanced, softly smokey beer too, but its just too sweet for me, in the end.
Bottle 33 cl. Black with a minimal lightbrown head. Roasted aroma, chocolate and dark fruits. Light bitter, sweet with a varm chocolate ending.

Black pour, thin tan head which fades away quickly. Aroma is roasted malts, brown sugar, some smokiness. Soft taste, smooth mouthfeel. The end is a little bit bitter with slight smoke taste to it. I dont find this one very special but its not bad.

Bottle. Black body brown head. Aroma is roasted caramel malts with some very nice embedded smoke. Taste is a little bit thin some smoke some caramel some coffee and hints of sourness. Aftertaste is nice roasted caramel bitterness with sweet roasted malts bitterness and some smoke. Nice one.

Bottle shared at a smoked beer tasting at our place. Black with a quickly dissolving tan head. Syrup, vanilla aroma, followed by smoke, followed by prune. Smoke, phenol, alcohol and plum liquor in the mouth. Smooth, full body, low carbonation, a little smoky finish.
Bottle, 330 from Magic Beer Room, Zagreb. Pours hazy brown with beige head. Roasted malts, chocolate, hint of smoke. Easy drinkable.

In aroma mostly smoked notes. Smoked dark malts, with a bit of coffee. From the glass theres a tiny sour note as well. The beer is pitch black, clear, almost non transparent. Almost no head. In taste is almost classical porter. Its a mix of malty sweetness, dark malts bitterness and a few chocolate flavours. Smoked note is very small but you can feel it. In the end there is a bit bigger bitterness, but very sharp and short, and aftertaste is mainly sweet. No taste of alcohol at all. Its a bit too much carbonated, except that the mouth feel is great. Its very clear and crisp, because of the lager yeast. This is a very good beer in overall, but I was expecting a bit more to be honest.

Pours an opaque black with a shortlived brown fluffy head. Aroma is smoked malts, slight caramel and coffee. Taste is smokey, peaty, dark chocolate, slight sweet caramel/butterscotch, coffee and medium cocoa bitterness. Medium-full bodied.

A deep dark porter with a thick creamy brown head. In aroma, sweet caramel chocolate malt with light peated whiskey notes, light floral hops, nice. In mouth, sweet caramel chocolate malt with light peated notes, whisky, light alcohol warmth, very nice. On tap at Le Triangle.

330ml botlle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Black color with dark beige head. Roasted malty aroma, light chocolate, dark fruits, light coffee. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma, with smoked notes, some leather. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

0,33 l bottle from EDEKA Mohr, best before 22/7/2017. Clear, very dark red and almost black with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate and cocoa, surrounded by fruity notes of prunes and raisins with a bit of lovage as well. Sweetish taste of dark chocolate and cocoa, fruity notes as mentioned, followed by a relatively long, slightly bitter, earthy finish of coffee. Not sure where the smoked malts have gone. Medium body, smooth and oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Besides the weird aroma of lovage, this is a very decent and tasty beer. Rich fruity notes pair well with the dark chocolate flavour. Surprisingly, I miss the expected smokiness, preventing this one from being anything special.

AROMAT: slodowy, palony, praktycznie wedzonka niewyczuwalna WYGLAD: ciemnabrazowe, przejrzyste, piana brunatna, bardzo szybko opada Smak: bogaty w smak porter, alkohol zamaskowany, Pijalnosc: tresciwe, gladkie Ogolnie: bardzo fajny porter

27-MAR-2014, bottle @Papsø clear all tasting, @Amager Bryghus with Ulkløbben.
Dark Brown, low tan head. Aroma is weak with smoke, roast and caramel. Taset is more smoked, sweet, malt. Watery, soft carbonation. Nice, easy drinking smoked porter.

Bottle sampled at Amager Bryghus, thanks to Papsø. Black with a small light brown head. Caramel, light smoke and wood in the nose. Aroma has light coffee, chocolate, dark wood, wort, light smoke. Medium body, oily texture, pleasant sweetness and some alcohol warmth. Ok, but a bit sticky and hot.
Bottle. Black color, wispy tan head. Oak, vanilla and cholate aroma. Slightly smoky flavor with sweet chocolate, oak and some warming alcohol. Full body, medium carbonation. Pretty good.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours an opaque black with a light brown head. Roasty, chocolatey aroma - hardly any smoke aroma. Rich, full body, tar and leather, roast and bitter chocolate with a subtle smokiness adding just a gentle edge. As it should. I normally dont like smoked beers, but this one is very nice. 270315
22.8.2014. Black beer with brown dense head. Malty aroma with herbs, bread. Tastes smoked malts, red berries.
Tap at Hathor. Great smoky nose, chocolate, umami, soy. Sweet and creamy flavor, nicely smoky, chocolate and coffee. Tasty stuff.

330ml bottle. Dark brown pour with small tanned head. aroma is chocolate, bitter roasted coffee beans, a little smoke, burnt toast and a little alcohol. Very smooth. Not thin but not thick mouth feel. Really nice. Lasting coffee finish. Not overly smoked.

Deep brown color, beige head. Coffee nose, chocolate, roasted malt, bread, burnt sugar, licorice. Sweet taste, chocolate, burnt sugar, licorice, light bitter coffee. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

Bottle. A dark brown beer with a small, dense, beige head. The aroma is lightly smoked, its roasted and chocolatey, with a touch of coffee and burnt malts. Its full-bodied and with a very soft carbonation. Some smoked notes, with coffee, roasted malts and a touch of chocolate in the flavor. Lasting finish. Quite nice this one, a bit too gently for me, but its easy drinkable and quite tasteful. 150314

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, smoke and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long caramel, smoke and roasted finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Really good smoked porter, just the right balance of sweetness, creaminess and smokiness. Huge chocolate hit too. Fantastic.

Near perfect smoked porter. what a beautiful style this is. Smooth, smokey but enough other flavors to make this a really tasty, flavorful beer. 

Van Erp, Roden
the aroma is caramel and fruity with hints of chocolate and toast... the taste is caramel and chocolate with notes of licorice, dark fruits, toast and toffee... sweet and dry aftertaste...
Toast, chocolate, roasty, licorice, smoke, vanilla, woody very good innit a pleasant drink

Close to black body, but with a copper hue. Small, long-lived, medium brown head that laces the glass fairly well. Strong, malty, sweet and complex aroma of roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, dark dried fruits (prunes and dates) and hints of smoke. Strong flavour of dark caramel, chocolate, mild coffee, dark dried fruits, dark berries and alcohol. Gentle smoke in the back and hints of brown sugar and maple syrup. Moderate sweet taste with a long, moderate to light bitter finish. Close to full-bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. Complex, exciting and enjoyable!
[33 cl bottle, batch 251, enjoyed 2.5 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge, Oslo]

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je slabí uzené. Pěna je světle hnědá, jemná, vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je temná. Chuť je velmi příjemná uzená, nasládlá s jemným nádechem ovoce. V ústech pivo působí plně, má střední říz a je vcelku dobře pitelné. Jedná se o zajímavý porter, který nezklame.

Pours black, with a foamy brown head that vanishes after a few seconds. Aromas of treacle and malts. Sweet and sticky in the mouth, roasted malts, treacle, alcohol. Dont get much of the smokiness, and a bit on the sickly side for me. Nice warmth from the alcohol.
Svart med lavt skum. Aroma av lær og lakris. Noe røyk. Smaken er sjokolade, noe røyksmak. Ganske søt. Medium konsistens.

Fast schwarz, hellbrauner Schaum. Rauch, wenig Kaffe und Schoggi, Leder und Röstmalzig süss. Recht malziger und wenig Süss zu Beginn kommt schöne Bittere dazu. Cremig süss und vollmundig, nicht viel Co2. Rauch und leichter Kaffee/Schoggi bleiben von Beginn bis in den Abgang welcher auch leicht bitter-trocken ist. Sehr feines Porter!
On tap at Brewdog Barcelona. Smoked and roasted aroma. Smoked, roasted, chocolate taste, slightly sweet. Medium body.

Pours a deep black color, topped with a thin beige colored head. Initially strong smoked aroma, develops some roasty and slightly fruity notes later on. Taste is sweet and fruity with smoked notes in the back and in the finish. Very nice, not too much smoke and pleasantly fruity. Didnt expect that, really, so nice surprise.

Pours black with a small fading head.
Nose shows soft smoke and nice complex roast.
Smoky and roasty flavours too but well-balanced with a dry finish.

Bottle. 
Very dark brown, beige head. 
Aroma: dark fruit, licorice, chocolate. 
Taste: fruity, licorice, cocoa powder, toffee. 
Not much smokiness in here but a nice one all the same.

330ml bottle. Jet black colour with average to huge, frothy, resoundingly diminishing, minimally lacing, tan head. Minimally roasty, dark malty aroma has notes of treacle, liquorice, malt lozenge, tar, chocolate, a touch of smoke and peat. Taste is simultaneously moderately sweet and minimally tart, dark malty, notes of treacle, liquorice, chocolate, dark berries, sweet bread, burnt sugar, a touch of smoke and leather; far from light, nevertheless somehow a bit watery. Such kind of description may sound like a sequence of multifaceted aspects, but has its foundation in the fact, that this beers subtance is simply unseizable; it doesnt incorporate all those features, it rather includes not one of them accurately - double-edged.

Barwa i piana: barwa czarna, z lekko rubinowymi przebłyskami, wydaje się klarowna. Piana beżowa, kremowa /drobno pęcherzykowa, średniej wielkości i umiarkowanie trwała. 

Aromat: sporo estrów (maliny, wiśnie, ale w czekoladzie). Delikatna kawa, czekolada mleczna, ograniczona paloność (bardziej w stronę tostów) i subtelna wędzonka torfowa. Lekka słodycz, łamana kwaskowością i nuta alkoholowa. 

Smak: lekka słodycz z kwaskową kontrą i wyczuwalnymi na wstępie nutami owocowymi. Następnie czekolada gorzka i mleczna, kawa, melanoidyny, lekka wędzonka. Alkohol wyczuwalny, aczkolwiek dość dobrze zamaskowany. 

Goryczka i odczucie w ustach: maksymalnie umiarkowana goryczka (słodowo- alkoholowo- chmielowa), raczej delikatna i niezbyt długa. Krągła pełnia, niskie do umiarkowanego wysycenie i jedynie lekka alkoholowa końcówka. Finisz raczej wytrawny alkoholowo- palony.

Piłem go uprzednio w wersji beczkowej i wydał mi się wówczas o wiele bardziej interesujący, a co ważniejsze intensywny w aromacie i smaku. W wersji butelkowej także nie jest źle, choć barwa wydaje się odrobinę zbyt ciemna, a piana niebyt trwała. W aromacie i smaku jest przyjemnie, jednak miałem nadzieję na więcej nut wędzonych. Na plus dobrze ukryty alkohol, bowiem mimo dość wysokiego poziomu nie poraża. Jak na BrewDoga całkiem ułożone i stonowane piwo. Być może browar powinien częściej warzyć w kolaboracji...

Excellent. Not a beer to get hammered on, one to enjoy slowly and savour every drop. Bacon and smoke aftertaste. Pure joy!

Coffee, dark chocolate, licorice, smoke, roasted malts, leather and vanilla in the aroma. Almost black with a red tint, small tan head.Medium + sweet and medium bitter. Medium to full body with a average to soft carbonation. Overall quite nice, but a bit to weak in the flavour and a bit to carbonated for my taste for this style of beer.

Pours black with a medium head. Aroma: some smoked aroma (not too strong), followed by chocolate. Taste: very well balanced chocolate, coffe and smoked taste. Also dominating roasted malt. Aroma: Dark chocolate, coffee, smoked malts and alcohol. Taste: Dark chocolate, cocoa, sweet coffee, light roasty and smoked flavour. No head, no lacing and medium carbonation. Price [Warsaw, Poland] 18PLN (bottle)
Tap. Smoke is quite subtle, got some scotch ale toffee sweetness with coffee bitterness. Black treacle. Lightly burnt. Quite nice.

330 mml bottle tasted on the 14/11/2014. Dark deep brown to black colour with a medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, berries and smoked malts. Taste is medium smoke, chocolate and roasty notes. Carbonation is medium. Sweet and dry aftertaste. Next one please!
Poured very deep dark brown with a frothy beige head. Aroma of lightly rauched malt, sweet berries, coffee and chocolate. Medium body, flaovur is lightly peaty, flavour much as the aroma, fudge.

33cl bottle from BD Shoreditch, London. It pours a dark deep brown color with a large mocha head. Aroma is deeply roasty with minimal smoke. Notes of charred wood, espresso, dark chocolate, vanilla. Taste is big roasty flavours, sweet chocolate sponge and light ashy roastiness. Finishes relatively dry with hints of citrus and charcoal. Overall, really good porter, not really a fully smoked beer I would say.

33cl bottle. Very dark brown with a nice tan head. Medium to full body with low carbonation. Quite sweet with some smokey and bitter tones. Roasted malts, dark chocolate, caramel, brown sugar, hops, vanilla and some herbs. A lovely hoppy smokey porter.

A light, cocoa, refreshing, dark beer. Bubbly but smooth mouthfeel & a whole load of chocolate. Scrumptious!

Rated by BrewTom

Bottle - black with a fizzy dark brown/reddish head which lasts about 20 seconds before fading to a thin ring. Some light lacing. One of the best looking beers Ive had, actually. Aroma is smokey and tarry with roasted malt, some chocolate and a hint of soy. Taste is chocolate and vanilla with smokey and roasty notes. Medium body, medium carbonation. A little sticky and a bit too sweet. Nice, but for something claiming to be a smoked beer it isnt particularly smoky.

Bottle. Black with nice beige head that doesn't last too long. Sweet chocolate, Palm sugar and spices, berries and a light roasted touch. Some smoke on the nose and a lingering smoke and bitter finish. Slick feel and medium body. Quite nice stuff, very solid porter.

The beer poured almost black. Its head was small and lightly brew. Aroma had chocolate, smoke, cocoa, burnt malts and sweetness. Palate was rather full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were chocolate, burnt malts, sweetness, ash and bitterness. Aftertaste had burntness, chocolate, coffee and bitterness. A rather balanced brew with strong flavours.
I like it a lot. Surprisingly sweet and oily but with strong smokey notes. A decent citrus hops backbone and very smooth considering ABV. Well done.
Smell of smoke, bread. Black colour, brown head. Aroma of tar, licorice. Flat carbon, oily texture. Very bitter.

Bottle @ BeerTemple, Amsterdam.
Thick black, full beige head. Fresh porter nose and taste with feint hints of smoke. Could've been bit more, but nice. Well balanced.

Tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Poured a deep mahogany with a round light tan head. The aroma is roasted malt, molasses, light coffee. The flavour is moderate to strong bitter with a roasty liqourice bitter, light smoke palate. Mediun bodied with soft carbonation. A little alcoholic with lots of roasty bitterness but not much else.

Aroma of dark roasted malt, smoke, coffee, some chocolate. Flavour is medium sweet with an equally medium bitterness in the aftertaste. Nice full body. The smoke is mild in this one, but its a very tasty Porter nonetheless.
Noire, fine mousse beige. Nez de café, pain grillé. Bouche sur le café également, chocolat. Bonne carbonation, amertume moyenne. Bien mais rien de spécial.

0,33 l bottle from Biervana 
caramel, roasty, nuts, cereal, bubblegum, herbs, spicy, hazy, minimal head, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, soft carbonation, long finish,
Pours black with a tan head. Chocolate and smoke on the nose. Drinks well malted, chocolate and tobacco. Finish slightly tart and ashy. Small warmth on top of the lungs

Flaska od Brew Dog Slovensko a maj darling.:-) 
Farba a hustota cierna a hutnejsia. Celkovo kombinacia porter a smoked je dokonala. Alkohol je krasne zakonponovany do plnej chuti piva kde je krasne citit horku cokoladu, karamelovy slad, vanilku, kavu plus jemne kyslaste zakoncenie. 
Podla mna je toto pivo vyborne a dokonale na prijemny vecerny relax s kombinaciou s cokoladovym chees cake kom.

Bottled. Pitch black color, beige head. Aroma of light smoked meat, major roasted malt, coffee, sweet chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, pleasantly sour a bit finishing with minor bitterness. Alcohol undetectable, completely cloaked. Overall a fantastic brew!

zwart met schuimige bruine kraag. aroma van chocolade, espresso, gebrande en geroosterde mouten, zeer zeer licht gerookt. smaken zijn redelijk zoet, licht bitter, zeer licht zuurtje, redelijk fruitig, iets van vanille, stevige volle en romige smaken, geen extreme koffie in dit bier. volle body, romig en dik in de mond, lage co2, afdronk zoetig. erg lekker en goed gebalanceerd zacht, maar de rooktoets is zeker met de onderzeeër ten onder gegaan !
Pours jet black, nice beige head. Aroma is not overwhelming, hints of black malts, slight smoked note. Taste is well-ballanced, evident smokiness, a bit of chocolate. Good beer

Bottle at home. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, not much smoke, but a hint of hops. Taste is sweet, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, more tobacco than smoke, long lasting dark chocolate aftertaste. Nice, but expected a bit more.
Drank from a bottle. Good, strong tasting porter. The taste is a bit sweet and caramelly.

I like the fact it is not only smoke but also shit loads of coffee. Very well balanced in my opinion.

Mouthfeel creamy. 
Amazing beer.

Medium, rather dense rusty-brown head over black beer. Sweet, malty nose; Bock-like. Warm chocolate sauce, wood-y. Smoked? Burnt/roasted notes with again lots of sweet malts beneath. 33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, cocoa, chocolate, vanilla, and a tiny bit of smoke - with a slightly bitter finish.
Belle couleur noire; petite mousse brune; arômes et goût de café et chocolat noir; un peu de fumée; finale douce-amère; les 8,4% dalcool se font discrets

Bottle from Drinkstore [220914]

Taste of smooth dark malts, soft roast, soft hickory smoke, meaty smoky malts, no alcohol, dark chocolate

Overall - Nice sweet soft smoke, smooth, no harsh over woody burnt crap in this. Good - like the fairly subtle smoke.

330 ml bottle

Certainly 1 of the better smoked beers in my opinion.

Zwarte kleur met een goede bruine kraag. Ruikt crème, vanille, peated em gerookt. Smaakt gerookt, vanille en beetje ziltig. Iets petead nasmaak. Scherpe koolzuur.

Fruity aroma while the smoke is subtle. Light hops, fresh grass.
Taste of light roasted malts, lots of chocolate, again just a hint of smoke, vanilla touches on the finish, fruity notes, well hidden alcohol.

Very good.

Bottle at home. Smoky and dark chocolate aroma. Smells already delicious. Rich, dark fruit and roasty notes. Toasty sweet malt finish. Very tasty oh yeah!

Bottle @ Van Moll Brewpub. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized light brown head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma is malts, dark and roasted malts, smoke. Wow, one of the best smoked beers Ive ever had for sure!

33cl, new exclusive Scottish collab. brew Anno 2014, from Geers Oostakker, complex smoked Porter, malty/roasted and slightly smoked/spicy/sweet, not too heavy, balanced, hazy, good head, good brew, yet expensive!
Black colour, small beige head. Aroma of smoked malts, bitter chocolate, cocoa. Taste is slightly sweet, light bitter. Medium body, oily texture, soft to average carbonation.

Bottle at BeerTemple, Amsterdam. Black with a good beige head. Aroma is chocolate, dates, caramel, very subtle hint of smoke, vanilla. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, soft on the palate with a sweet finish, subtle bitterness on the aftertaste. Taste is milk chocolate, vanilla, dates, caramel, very subtle hint of smoke. Pretty good but a little more smoke would balance the sweetness better.

Bottle from drink store. Dark pour, ruby highlights, no head. Aroma is super, rich, dark chocolate, espresso coffee and some smoke. Flavour has all the elements of the aroma, really nicely balanced. Smoke is there but not over the top. Decent body, medium carbonation, long coffee bitter finish. Lovely.

Pours black with a thin off white head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate as usual. Good smooth, easy to drink body, with soft carbonation. Balanced taste: smooth chocolate and coffee, vanilla, caramel. I did not get the smoke anywhere... but the finish is long and nicely balanced.

Aroma: bitter chocolate, coffee, smoked notes. Appearance: blach color and beige head. Taste: liw bitterness, dried fruits, chocolate, roasted dark malts, coffee, smoked notes (whisky malt), quite sweet and smooth. Palate: fully body and low carbonation, smoked finish. Overall: interesting smoked lager, recommended.

Tap at Beer Hunters. 
Dark opaque brown color, good brown creamy head. Smokey bacony aroma. Medium-bodied. Chocolate, smoke, sweetish maltyness. Licorice in the finish. Interesting rauchbier.

Dark brown in colour with medium tan head. Aroma is roasty, coffee, cocoa, some raisins. A bit smokey nose, but it lacks in the aroma. Medium body. Expected a bit more!

Draught @ OHaras, Tampere. Pours a dark brown colour with a small head. Aroma of smoke, some herbs and bread. Flavour of rich bready malts, smoke, some wood, red berries and leather. Medium bodied. Soft. Feels heavy.

Had this in bottle at Syches, Campsite, Much Wenlock, Thursday 22nd August 2014   Pours black, smokey in mouth, soft, a little liquorice and treacle. Bittersweet, warming alcohol with a little chocolate. A bit beefy, thick in mouth.  A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov13 3.4
Tap at kaisla, helsinki. Black color, tanned head. Aroma is smoke, licorice, roasty. Taste is nicely roasty, smoke, coffee, hops at the end.

Tap @ OHaras Freehouse.
Pours deep dark ruby red color with a small a head. Lots of dark berries, dark malts and chocolate on the flavor. A bit sweet and malty, decent though.
5325

(Keg at Kaisla, 20140821) The beer poured almost black. Its head was small and lightly brew. Aroma had chocolate, smoke, cocoa, burnt malts and sweetness. Palate was rather full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were chocolate, burnt malts, sweetness, ash and bitterness. Aftertaste had burntness, chocolate, coffee and bitterness. A rather balanced brew with strong flavours.

Draught @ Kaisla
Aroma has toffee typical to English ales and smoke. Also some licorice. Flavour has licorice, syrupy tones, brown sugar. Fin7shes with strong licorice tones. Smoke is hidden behind the sweetness. Wouldnt recognize this as smoked in blind tasting. Still rather nice stuff. I like the licorice here.
Tap @ Kaisla. Nose is coffee and vanilla. Taste is burned malt with liquorice. Ok but not great.
bottle at home ... dark black ... big tan head ... light smoke ... dark dry chocolate roast nose ...dark roast ... soft sweet chocolate ...massive chocolate roast ... pretty good

Bottle from brewdog brewery Ellon. Pours an oily black with a thick tan head which fades after a while. Excellent lacing. Aromas of burnt toast, dark chocolate and treacle toffee with a slight stale smoke whiff. Lovely thick taste of again dark chocolate and treacle with a nice wood smoke linger. Hides the 8.4% incredibly well. Very nice!
Near jet black with a beige head. Aromas of dark chocolate, roasts and treacle. Some lactose. Faint smoke. Taste balanced bitter and sweetness. Palate quite full. Mild alcohol burn.

33cl bottle thanks to allmyvinyl. 
Appearance - opaque black with a generous fawn head. 
Nose - dark chocolate going into treacle. The smoked note is very delicate. 
Taste - dark chocolate again and with raisins and nuts in the background. 
Palate - medium to full bodied with a creamy texture and a very balanced and finish. 
Overall - rich yet extremely elegant and more - ish. Didnt get much smoke though.

Bottle from Cornelius, Edinburgh. It pours jet black with a thick tan head. The nose smooth smoke, ham, toasty, ashy, charred and sweet treacle. The taste is smooth, roasty, earth, charred wood, smoke, treacle, light spice and cocoa with a dry, smoked finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Hides abv very well indeed. Solid.

Keg at the new bar in Clapham. Black or very dark brown, small tan head. Aroma is roast malt, smoke, yeast. Body is medium, quite foamy, low carbonation. Taste has noticeable yeast character, red berry and smoke.
Draft - Smoke and chocolate. Jet black with a nice brown head. Sweet dark chocolate and light smoke. Not enough smoke for my taste.

330ml bottle, pours black with a tan head, chocolate malt backbone, cocoa, rich and full bodied, mild smoky character, finishes dry, carbonation soft. Was hoping for a bit more, but this well done, and very drinkable for the abv

Bottle from BottleDog London and drunk at home. Black beer lasting tan head. Some light smoke. Some roasted malt, some burnt toast on finish, some hop. Like Ken says, its a little disappointing for such a big beer from 2 good collab breweries. Decent but nothing too special. Perhaps my palate is jaded these days. Some coffee. As I say the smoke is very light and more ashtray than full on Bamberg smoked meat or cheese. OK.

8th August 2014RBESG pt 11. Brewdog Shoreditch, Keg. Opaque daek brown beer, small pale tan head. Palate is light and crisp. Rich dark malts, dark chocolate, mild dry coffee. Touch of thin dry malt cream. Not really getting that much smoke. Finishes crisp and dry. A bit of non entity for such a big collab but fine.

330ml bottle at home from Brewdog Online Shop. Pours black with a short-lived tan head. Smoke aromas, alongside chocolate and treacle. Taste has more smokiness, light sweet, rich dark chocolate. Quite a light body, reminiscent of a baltic porter. Roasted bitter finish. Nice.
Keg at brewdog Cardifffull bodied black beer, dense tan head. Chocolate, toasty, fairly sweet. Robustly bitter but malts are the star here, warming but not heavy.

Nice one. Pours black with low tan head. Roasty nose with vanilla, chocolate and light coffee. Taste is initially fairly sweet ,vanilla and chocolate, followed by a roasty bitter finish. Medium, smooth to creamy body with soft carbonation.

Keg at Brewdog shore ditch. Opaque black pour with lasting cream coloured head. Aroma is mineral, blood, salt choc, semi sweet, nutty caramel malts. Hint of smoke, but very smooth.palate is medium sweet,highish carbonation.

Keg at BDSB. Jet black, caramel head. Aroma is coffee, fig rolls, chocolate mousse, burnt toast, new shoes, barbecue. Flavour is cocoa powder, chocolate fudge, a touch of burnt toast, sweet coffee, toasted pecans. Perfect medium body for a Baltic porter - very easy drinking for the ABV. Excellent.
